definition: to open wide
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
dog hole wide open (idiom); fig. gap caused by missing teeth (used mockingly)
see 開齋節|开斋节[Kai1 zhai1 jie2]
imaginative/to have one's mind buzzing with ideas

sentences.english: And that's the reason why the Fed has decided on the second round of its money printing plan.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲何美聯儲決定第二次大開印鈔機的原因。

sentences.english: Li Zhongzheng back and found the gates open, they hurriedly drove past view.
sentences.chinese: 李中正回城後發現城門大開，他們慌忙趕過去查看。

sentences.english: That night, she had an eye-opening experience.
sentences.chinese: 那天晚上，她有個眼界大開的經歷。

sentences.english: Each saw the plate melon, I immediately opened the appetite.
sentences.chinese: 每一看到那盤瓜，我頓時食慾大開。

sentences.english: I am sure this food will whet their appetites.
sentences.chinese: 我敢肯定，這些菜能讓他們大開胃口。

sentences.english: Do you believe they can hope in someday gaining sight and freedom?
sentences.chinese: 你相信他們希望有一天會眼界大開，獲得自由嗎？

sentences.english: She pulls the bag open wide so her great-grandmother can see inside. "Oh, my favorite."
sentences.chinese: 她把袋子拽得大開，好讓太婆看到裏面的東西。

sentences.english: Living in another country can be a real eye-opener.
sentences.chinese: 生活在另外一個國家真讓人眼界大開。

sentences.english: This Sichuan hot-pot really works up my appetite.
sentences.chinese: 這個四川火鍋真是喫得我胃口大開。

sentences.english: My mother drove me to the flight terminis with the windows rolled down.
sentences.chinese: 媽媽開車送我去的機場，一路上車窗都大開着。

sentences.english: The river gates are flying open. The palace falls down and cracks.
sentences.chinese: 河門突然大開，宮殿就此被倒塌沖毀。

sentences.english: Just hearing these names is mouth-watering.
sentences.chinese: 光聽名字我就已經胃口大開了。

sentences.english: The city is also hot and humid, so windows are left open or air-conditioners whirr away day and night.
sentences.chinese: 而當地天氣溼熱，窗戶常常大開，空調日夜運轉。

sentences.english: I don't think Joe is a great lion.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲喬沒有大開獅子口。

definition: change of appearance/to revise one's point of view
(it's) no wonder (that...)/(it's) not surprising (that)
nothing other than/to differ in no way from/the same as/to amount to
wind direction/the way the wind blows/fig. trend/direction of events/how things develop (esp. how they affect oneself)/public opinion (concerning one's actions)/publicity (usually derog.)/limelight
to bloom/to open/to be open (to the public)/to open up (to the outside)/to be open-minded/unrestrained by convention/unconstrained in one's sexuality
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
it can clearly be seen (that this is the case)/it is (thus) clear/clear/visible
rich/wide/broad
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to open/to start/(computing) to enable
now/this moment
reason/cause
on end/in a row/in succession
honest/reasonable/fair/sensible
timely/just (when needed)
similar to/appearing to be
gall bladder/courage/guts/gall/inner container (e.g. bladder of a football, inner container of a thermos)
